H0.text: how long is one full rotation of the earth. 12 hours

H2.text: how long is one full rotation of the earth. 30 days

A4.text: A sidereal day on Earth is approximately 86164.0905 seconds (23 h 56 min 4.0905 s or 23.9344696 h).

A5.text: The Earth makes one rotation around its axis each sidereal day; during that time it moves a short distance (about 1Â°) along its orbit around the Sun.
